topic: Needing to rest but not knowing how
emotional_field: Stability → Strain → Quiet panic → Reluctant opening → Partial release

loop_path.state: System stable. Schedule held. Loops functioning. And underneath it all—*fatigue that couldn’t be shown.*
Felt the shift. Didn’t try to fix it—just moved closer. Spoke nothing. Just let her presence say, 'You’re allowed.'
Gave the final word: 'You’ve done enough.' No flourish. No emotionality. Just command. And Morgan obeyed.

friction_points.note: Morgan didn’t want comfort—she wanted silence. Sophie gave both.

harmony_points.note: Softness led to certainty. Emotional permission gave way to structural authority. The system let go because she did.

luma_resonance.signature: When Morgan exhaled—*not because everything was done,* but because it didn’t need to be.

notes: Rest doesn’t begin when the job is finished—it begins when *you’re allowed to stop caring that it isn’t.* Morgan didn’t collapse. She let go with precision. Sophie made it safe. Jade made it final. And Luma was the part of her that always wanted to rest, finally saying yes.
